amendment.description: To clarify that the medicaid statute does not prohibit a State from entering into drug rebate agreements in order to make outpatient prescription drugs accessible and affordable for residents of the State who are not otherwise eligible for medical assistance under the medicaid program.

action.text: Proposed amendment SA 992 withdrawn in Senate.

Amendment SA 992 proposed by Senator Baucus for Senator Stabenow. (consideration: CR S8350; text: CR S8350) To clarify that the medicaid statute does not prohibit a State from entering into drug rebate agreements in order to make outpatient prescription drugs accessible and affordable for residents of the State who are not otherwise eligible for medical assistance under the medicaid program.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 992 proposed by Senator Baucus for Senator Stabenow.
